intro: Seseli libanotis var. pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring rocky or gravelly soils. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. This variety is native to the Pyrenees Mountains and is often found in open, sunny habitats at high elevations.
